meanings.definition: To make a wet, splashing sound.
meanings.sent1: The kids were glopping in the puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent2: The water was glopping loudly as it poured down the drain.
meanings.sent3: The puppy enjoyed glopping around in the shallow stream.
meanings.sent4: The paint glopped onto the canvas, creating a messy masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef's soup glopped into the bowl, enticing everyone with its aroma.

meanings.definition: The act of making a wet, splashing sound.
meanings.sent1: I heard the glopping of the water as I approached the fountain.
meanings.sent2: The glopping of the mud made it clear that someone was walking nearby.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected glopping interrupted the peaceful silence of the pond.
meanings.sent4: The glopping of the rain on the roof was a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The glopping of the fish in the pond was a delightful sound on a sunny day.
